text: Soooo this just popped up in my Product Hunt feed
<https://magic.import.io/>

attachments.text: <http://import.io|import.io>'s automatic data extraction tool, input any url and it will magically return the data from those pages as a CSV or API.
attachments.fallback: <http://import.io|import.io>'s automatic data extraction tool, input any url and it will magically return the data from those pages as a CSV or API.

text: And I thought, what could I use this for?
So I searched for Pinot Noir on Wine Library
<https://magic.import.io/?csvRedirect=true&site=https:%2F%2Fwinelibrary.com%2Fwines%2Fcabernet-sauvignon%2F2011-anderson-s-conn-valley-cabernet-sauvignon-reserve-82219>

attachments.text: <http://import.io|import.io>'s automatic data extraction tool, input any url and it will magically return the data from those pages as a CSV or API.
attachments.fallback: <http://import.io|import.io>'s automatic data extraction tool, input any url and it will magically return the data from those pages as a CSV or API.

text: and it spits out a lovely downloadable CSV
also, they have an API
Niiiiiiiiiiiiiiiice
I believe <@U02618EV1> had a nice service for Csv -> api too
<https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1WLhKQCRD04or-VaTTvoySC2MDuwc9h4lHpncObI1RUQ/edit?usp=sharing>
If <http://import.io|import.io> has a cost
not sure yet - but that gave us nearly 400 bottles of Pinot Noir data
including high res bottle label images
it tops off at 20 pages of download, but that's worked for the varietals I've searched for so far (all under 20 pages)
well, it doesn't give us the high res link, but we can abstract it from the suggestion.png URL (it's the same string/directory, but named original.png instead)
and it looks like it's free
Massive jackpot on K&L Wines - 37,000+ Cabernets listed. :simple_smile:
(if you add out of stock wines to your search)
does look like the csv download caps at 1,000 rows, would be interesting to run the API through it
<https://import.io/data/mine/?id=450d779b-0e9e-42a7-8a43-4424250be56f>
this is kinda nuts - such an elegant interface.
Jackpot indeed. I'll turn Gaston loose on this today to see how far we can get.
:police_car: i don’t think we need a full database of wine for the ecb demo :police_car:
True. Good Scope check.
I think we look at this for reference of the tables being used
and perhaps once we have our desired 24 wines, pull the data from here.
Also adding to the jackpot - we could do a recently tasted on Delectable lookup: <https://import.io/data/mine/?id=44ffb89a-2989-405d-91a4-eb8774a0c20f>
yeah, should definitely look to it for model and future use
but we can bake in the 24 bottles :smile:

I wasn’t assuming we’d be grabbing a full DB of info - rather, we’d pick our 24 (or 100 to have some breadth in the app), can it and run with that data set. Even getting basic info and high-res images has proven to be tough, so this will be a big help in getting that together.
